item.title: 停飞持续第三天，航空公司为航班延误做好准备
item.description: 由于政府拨款僵局仍在继续，美国联邦航空管理局（Federal Aviation Administration）面临着高于正常水平的空中交通管制人员配备问题，美国各大航空公司正准备应对周三连续第三天的航班延误。【原文：Major U.S. airlines are bracing for a third straight day of delays on Wednesday as the U.S. Federal Aviation Administration faces higher-than-normal staffing issues for air traffic controllers as the stalemate over funding the government continues.】

item.title: 国际铜业协会称，产量增长放缓将使铜市场在 2026 年出现赤字
item.description: 国际铜业研究小组（ICSG）称，由于产量增长放缓，预计 2026 年全球精炼铜市场将从之前预期的 20.9 万吨盈余转为 15 万吨赤字。【原文：The global refined copper market is expected to swing to a deficit of 150,000 metric tons in 2026 from the previously expected surplus of 209,000 tons due to slower production growth, the International Copper Study Group (ICSG) said.】

item.title: 国际货币基金组织总裁称全球经济表现 "好于预期"，但风险依然存在
item.description: 国际货币基金组织（International Monetary Fund, 简称 "基金组织"）总裁周三表示，尽管面临多重冲击带来的严重压力，世界经济的韧性已超出预期，他预测今年和2026年全球经济增长将略有放缓。【原文：The world economy has proven more resilient than expected despite acute strains from multiple shocks, the head of the International Monetary Fund said on Wednesday, forecasting only a slight slowing of global growth this year and in 2026.】

item.title: 分析师称，铝厂火灾将给福特公司带来高达 10 亿美元的损失
item.description: 据 Evercore ISI 分析师周三发布的一份报告称，纽约一家铝厂发生火灾，预计将影响福特汽车 F-150 卡车的生产数月之久，这将使该汽车制造商的盈利减少多达 10 亿美元。【原文：A fire at a New York aluminum plant that is expected to affect production of Ford Motor's F-150 truck for months will sap up to $1 billion from the automaker's earnings, according to a Wednesday note from Evercore ISI analysts.】

item.title: 阿根廷取消铝、钢及其衍生产品出口税至年底
item.description: 根据官方公报公布的一项决议，阿根廷政府暂时取消了铝、钢及其衍生产品的出口税，直至 2025 年底。【原文：Argentina's government temporarily eliminated export taxes on aluminum, steel, and derivatives until the end of 2025, according to a resolution published in the official gazette.】

item.title: 思科推出旨在远距离连接人工智能数据中心的芯片
item.description: 思科系统公司周三推出了一款新的网络芯片，旨在连接人工智能数据中心，微软和阿里巴巴的云计算部门已成为该芯片的客户。【原文：Cisco Systems launched on Wednesday a new networking chip designed to connect artificial intelligence data centers, with the cloud computing units of Microsoft and Alibaba enrolling as the chip's customers.】

item.title: 瑞银审查 5 亿美元 First Brands 风险敞口对基金的影响
item.description: 瑞银集团周三表示，正在研究 First Brands 破产对其几只投资基金的影响，这家瑞士银行在这家倒闭的美国汽车零部件供应商身上的风险超过 5 亿美元。【原文：UBS said on Wednesday it was examining the impact of the bankruptcy of First Brands on several of its investment funds, with the Swiss bank exposed to the tune of more than $500 million to the collapsed U.S. auto parts supplier.】

item.title: 国际航空运输协会（IATA）会长称美国停摆不会造成航班严重中断
item.description: 航空公司游说团体国际航空运输协会（IATA）总干事威利-沃尔什（Willie Walsh）周三表示，美国政府关门并未严重影响国内商业航班，也没有阻止新空中交通管制员的招聘。【原文：The U.S. government shutdown hasn't significantly disrupted domestic commercial flights nor has it stopped the recruitment of new air traffic controllers, Willie Walsh, director general of airline lobby group IATA said on Wednesday.】

item.title: 杰富瑞披露 7.15 亿美元基金受 First Brands 破产影响
item.description: 投资银行杰富瑞（Jefferies）周三披露，其旗下的卢卡迪亚资产管理公司（Leucadia Asset Management）基金持有约 7.15 亿美元的应收账款，这些账款与破产的汽车零部件制造商 First Brands 集团有关。【原文：Investment bank Jefferies disclosed on Wednesday that its Leucadia Asset Management fund holds about $715 million in receivables linked to bankrupt auto-parts maker First Brands Group.】

item.title: HealthTap 加入礼来在线平台，提供糖尿病管理服务
item.description: 远程医疗公司 HealthTap 周三表示，它将加入礼来公司的数字医疗平台 LillyDirect，提供虚拟糖尿病管理服务。【原文：Telehealth company HealthTap said on Wednesday it is joining Eli Lilly's digital healthcare platform, LillyDirect, to offer virtual diabetes management services.】

item.title: 可口可乐将在美国便利店推出 7.5 盎司迷你罐装饮料
item.description: 可口可乐公司明年初将在美国便利店推出 7.5 盎司的迷你单罐苏打水，希望资金紧张和注重热量的消费者会被这种更小、更便宜的饮料所吸引。【原文：Coca-Cola is introducing mini 7.5-ounce single-serve cans of some of its sodas in U.S. convenience stores early next year, hoping cash-strapped and calorie-conscious consumers will be attracted to the smaller, cheaper drinks.】

item.title: 英国央行称，如果市场对人工智能或美联储自由度的情绪变坏，市场将面临 "急剧修正
item.description: 英格兰银行（Bank of England）周三警告说，如果投资者对人工智能的前景或美国联邦储备局（U.S. Federal Reserve）的独立性感到不满，全球金融市场可能会暴跌。【原文：Global financial markets could tumble if investors' mood sours on the prospects for artificial intelligence or the independence of the U.S. Federal Reserve, the Bank of England warned on Wednesday.】

item.title: 屋顶材料公司 TopBuild 以 10 亿美元收购竞争对手 SPI
item.description: TopBuild 公司周三表示，它已以 10 亿美元现金收购了特种产品和保温材料公司（SPI）。【原文：TopBuild Corp said on Wednesday it has acquired Specialty Products and Insulation (SPI) for $1 billion in cash, about a year after the two building material makers had terminated their initial agreement over anti-trust concerns.】

item.title: 汇丰银行将 2025 年平均银价预测上调至每盎司 38.56 美元
item.description: 汇丰银行（HSBC）周三将 2025 年的白银平均价格预期从每盎司 35.14 美元上调至 38.56 美元，理由是金价高企、投资者需求恢复以及预期交易波动。【原文：HSBC on Wednesday raised its average silver price forecasts for 2025 to $38.56 per ounce from $35.14 citing expectations for high gold prices, renewed investor demand, and anticipated volatile trading.】

item.title: 早间竞价奇特的一对--飙升的股票和黄金
item.description: 当今美国和全球市场的重要事件【原文：What matters in U.S. and global markets today】

item.title: 摩根大通表示，到 2027 年，稳定币可能会带来 1.4 万亿美元的额外美元需求
item.description: 摩根大通（JPMorgan）的分析师在周二的一份报告中说，如果有足够多的海外投资者希望拥有这些数字资产，那么到2027年，稳定币的采用可能会产生额外1.4万亿美元的美元需求。【原文：The adoption of stablecoins could generate an additional $1.4 trillion in demand for U.S. dollars by 2027, if enough overseas investors want to own these digital assets, analysts at JPMorgan said in a note on Tuesday.】

item.title: 独家新闻：意大利检方试图就劳动剥削问题将 Tod's 移交法院管理
item.description: 意大利检方正寻求对制鞋商 Tod's 实施司法管理，指控其供应链中存在虐待工人的行为，这是一连串玷污意大利奢侈品牌形象的案件中的最新一起。【原文：Italian prosecutors are seeking to place shoemaker Tod's under judicial administration over alleged worker abuses in its supply chain, in the latest in a string of cases that have tainted the image of Italy's luxury brands.】

item.title: 雀巢退出减少乳制品甲烷排放全球联盟
item.description: 食品集团雀巢公司周三表示，它已退出旨在减少奶牛养殖对全球变暖影响的全球甲烷减排联盟。【原文：Food group Nestle said on Wednesday it had withdrawn from a global alliance for cutting methane emissions that aims to reduce the impact of dairy farming on global warming.】

item.title: Dayforce 最大股东计划投票反对 Thoma Bravo 的收购提议
item.description: Dayforce 的最大股东表示，计划投票反对 Thoma Bravo 提出的 123 亿美元收购这家人力资源软件公司的提议，称该提议 "令人失望"，是企图利用该行业的 "短期悲观情绪"。【原文：Dayforce's largest shareholder said it plans to vote against Thoma Bravo's proposed $12.3 billion buyout of the HR software firm, calling the offer "underwhelming" and an attempt to take advantage of "short-term pessimism" in the sector.】

item.title: Cenovus 将 MEG 能源公司的收购要约提高至 62 亿美元
item.description: 仙诺弗斯能源公司（Cenovus Energy）周三提高了收购 MEG 能源公司的报价，将包括债务在内的拟议交易价值提高到 86 亿加元（61.6 亿美元），试图与竞争对手斯特拉斯科纳资源公司（Strathcona Resources）的出价相抗衡。【原文：Cenovus Energy on Wednesday sweetened its offer to acquire MEG Energy , raising the value of its proposed deal to C$8.6 billion ($6.16 billion), including debt, in an attempt to match a rival bid from Strathcona Resources .】

item.title: 特斯拉廉价版 Model Y 在欧洲面临竞争激烈的局面
item.description: 在埃隆-马斯克（Elon Musk）的公司最需要帮助的地区--欧洲，特斯拉主打产品 Model Y SUV 和 Model 3 轿车的低价版面临着一场艰苦的战斗。【原文：Tesla's lower-priced versions of its staple Model Y SUV and Model 3 sedan face an uphill battle in the region where Elon Musk's company arguably needs help the most: Europe.】

item.title: 英国央行警告称，如果市场对人工智能或美联储的情绪变坏，市场将出现 "急剧修正
item.description: 作者：大卫-米利肯和菲比-西尔斯【原文：By David Milliken and Phoebe Seers】

item.title: 业绩食品公司似乎热衷于与竞争对手美国食品公司合作，以打造庞然大物
item.description: US Foods 长期以来一直在关注竞争对手 Performance Food，认为美国第二大和第三大食品服务分销商之间的潜在合作可以带来更多增长，挑战行业领导者 Sysco，并为消费者降低成本。【原文：US Foods has long had its eye on rival Performance Food , arguing a potential tie-up between the nation's No. 2 and No. 3 food service distributors could lead to more growth, challenge industry leader Sysco and cut costs for consumers.】

item.title: 减肥药和 MAHA 正在重创美国甜菜种植者
item.description: 多年来，甜菜一直是美国农民的生命线。美国国内生产的糖有一半以上来自这种白色根茎作物，世界第一大糖消费国的强劲需求使种植者免受玉米、大豆和小麦等不稳定作物的影响。【原文：For years, sugar beets were a lifeline for American farmers. More than half of domestically produced sugar comes from the white-fleshed root crops, and robust demand from the world’s top sugar-consuming nation has shielded growers from more volatile crops like corn, soybeans and wheat.】

item.title: 亚马逊药房将在 One Medical 网点推出电子处方亭
item.description: 亚马逊周三表示，其药房业务将于 12 月开始在其 One Medical 初级医疗点的电子自助服务机上开具一些常用药物处方，公司称这将减少就医障碍并限制运输成本。【原文：Amazon said on Wednesday its pharmacy business in December will begin filling some prescriptions for common medications at electronic kiosks in its One Medical primary care locations, which the company says will reduce barriers to access and limit shipping costs.】

item.title: 美联储对中性的看法由米兰重新调整，这是通胀问题的关键所在
item.description: 美联储新任理事斯蒂芬-米兰（Stephen Miran）在上个月的政策会议上呼吁大幅降息，但他的就职会议却引发了新一轮关于利率对经济的限制程度以及错误评估风险的讨论。【原文：New Federal Reserve Governor Stephen Miran may not have won converts to his call for steep interest rate cuts at last month's policy meeting, but his inaugural session has stirred fresh debate about how much rates are restricting the economy and the risks involved in getting that assessment wrong.】

item.title: 关注美联储评论和会议纪要，华尔街期货价格上扬
item.description: 由于投资者在等待美联储发言人的评论和央行 9 月份政策会议纪要的公布，美国股指期货在前一天下跌后于周三逐步走高。【原文：U.S. stock index futures inched higher on Wednesday after declines a day earlier as investors awaited commentary from Federal Reserve speakers and the release of minutes from the central bank's September policy meeting.】

item.title: 研究显示：欧洲小型企业在没有基本数字工具的情况下匆忙进入人工智能领域
item.description: 周三公布的一项研究显示，大多数欧洲中小型企业在整个业务中优先考虑人工智能系统，而不是基本的数字工具，在投资核心数字系统方面输给了大型企业。【原文：Most European small and mid-sized enterprises are prioritizing artificial intelligence systems over basic digital tools across their businesses, losing ground to bigger firms investing in core digital systems, a study published on Wednesday showed.】

item.title: 英央行FPC：如果对ai的预期变得不那么乐观，股票市场尤其容易受到影响
item.description: 这是一条突发新闻。全面报道将很快发布。【原文：This is a breaking news story. Full coverage will be available soon.】

item.title: 丰田和住友金属在固态电池阴极材料方面取得进展
item.description: 丰田公司和住友金属矿业公司周三表示，他们在电动汽车全固态电池阴极材料的开发方面取得了进展，并同意合作大规模生产这些材料。【原文：Toyota and Sumitomo Metal Mining said on Wednesday they have made advances in the development of cathode materials for all-solid-state batteries for electric cars, and have agreed to work together to mass produce those materials.】
